ygData.subject: RE: Charisma effect on magic resists
ygData.msgSnippet: I ama lvl 37 Bard, so its definitley not level related. I also had that problem you speak of with the Brass based songs, thats what I think this patch fixed ,
ygData.messageBody:
I ama lvl 37 Bard, so its definitley not level related. I also had that
problem you speak of with the Brass based songs, thats what I think this
patch "fixed", unfortunately it nerfed all the songs now, thus the missed
notes on songs I learned 30 levels ago. Prior to this patch missing a note
on even the level 23 song was unheard of, let alone Selo. With a class that
requires the twisting of songs during battle I am sure we are dying from
this.

-----Original Message-----
From: John Robertson [mailto:johnr@...]
Sent: Monday, August 09, 1999 12:27 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Charisma effect on magic resists


From: John Robertson <johnr@...>



"Chris Kuenster (Entex)" wrote:

> From: "Chris Kuenster (Entex)" <v-ntxck@...>
>
> You must need incredible Dex then because my base is 124 and with a Shaman
> buff it is 161, I still miss alot of notes.

This could well be. I don't claim to be absolutely correct on this, but I
think dexterity also has more face validity than charisma does when it comes
to
whether you miss a note.

Also note that the frequency of missed notes depends on how long you have
had
the song in question. When I first tried playing chords of dissonance with
a
horn, the missed notes were just unbelievable. I was like a junior high
school
band. :)

Jyzan
